fr.sorbonne_u.components.examples.basic_cs.components

Class URIProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.examples.basic_cs.components.URIProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentI

    public class URIProvider
extends AbstractComponent
    The class URIProvider implements a component that provides URI creation services.

    Description

    Invariant

     invariant              this.uriPrefix != null
 invariant              c.isOfferedInterface(URIProviderI.class)

    Created on : 2014-01-22

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Constructor Detail

      • URIProvider

        protected URIProvider(java.lang.String uriPrefix,
                      java.lang.String providerPortURI)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        create a component with a given uri prefix and that will expose its service through a port of the given URI.

        Contract

         pre    uriPrefix != null and providerPortURI != null
 post   this.uriPrefix.equals(uriPrefix)
 post   this.isPortExisting(providerPortURI)
 post   this.findPortFromURI(providerPortURI).getImplementedInterface().equals(URIProviderI.class)
 post   this.findPortFromURI(providerPortURI).isPublished()
        Parameters:
        uriPrefix - the URI prefix of this provider.
        providerPortURI - the URI of the port exposing the service.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.

        public void start()
           throws ComponentStartException
        Description copied from interface: ComponentI
        start the component; this method is automatically called by the component virtual machine after all components have been initialised and the component calls in turn its own inner components. Implementations of this method must always return the control.

        Contract

         pre    this.isInitialised()
 post   this.isStarted()
        Specified by:

      • provideURIService

        public java.lang.String provideURIService()
        produce and return an URI beginning with a substring that identifies the provider. Starting point is to define the service methods of the server component.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   ret != null and ret.startsWith(this.uriPrefix))
        Returns:
        the produced URI

      • provideURIsService

        public java.lang.String[] provideURIsService(int n)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        produce and return n URIs, each beginning with a substring that identifies the provider.

        Contract

         pre    n > 0
 post   ret != null and ret.size() == n
 post   post forall i in 0..numberOfRequestedURIs-1, ret[i] != null and ret[i].startsWith(this.uriPrefix))
        Parameters:
        n - number of requested URIs.
        Returns:
        array of n URIs considered as strings.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.
